intro: Latrienda brasiliensis, commonly known as the Brazilian lantana, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its clusters of small, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 6 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a rough texture, while its flowers are often arranged in terminal inflorescences. Latrienda brasiliensis is adapted to tropical and subtropical climates and thrives in well-drained soils.
